question: A gas is taken from state A to state B along two different paths 1 and 2. The heat absorbed and work done by the system along these two paths are <katex>$Q_1, Q_2$</katex> and <katex>$W_1, W_2$</katex> respectively. Then
explanation: According to the First Law of Thermodynamics, <katex>$\Delta U = Q - W$</katex>.
Since the initial and final states (A and B) are the same for both paths, the change in internal energy <katex>$\Delta U$</katex> is the same.
<katex>$\Delta U_1 = \Delta U_2 \Rightarrow Q_1 - W_1 = Q_2 - W_2$</katex>.
